items.sentence: Tom is still pretending he isn't interested.
Tom is in bed because he isn't feeling well.
Tom drinks, but he isn't drunk this morning.
I'd do anything just to hold you in my arms.
Tom has been a teacher here for three years.
Tom has a three-bedroom apartment in Boston.
Tom and Mary have to speak French at school.
I want to thank the lifeguard that saved me.
Tom isn't my younger son. He's my older son.
I want you to pay back the money you owe me.
Tom won't be back until a little after 2:30.
Tom probably isn't going to be back by 2:30.
You're never too old to learn something new.
I'll look after your dog while you are away.
That's the first letter Tom ever sent to me.
The exact cause of death is still a mystery.
Maybe you can show me how it's done one day.
The workers are threatening to go on strike.
Tom left for a while, but he's already back.
Now you be good while I'm gone, do you hear?
